string.description: Accessibility description for the back button displayed in the top corner of the VR application to go back to the previous screen. [CHAR LIMIT=50]
string.name: back_button_content_description

string.description: Short text shown in a button in the dialog box that shows up to help users configure their Cardboard experience. By clicking on this button, the user will cancel the setup flow and return to their previous activity. [CHAR LIMIT=20]
string.name: cancel_button

string.description: Text shown inside the dialog box that shows up to help users configure their Cardboard experience. This string is displayed when the user doesn't have the cardboard app installed. [CHAR LIMIT=200]
string.name: dialog_message_no_cardboard

resources.string: Get the Cardboard app in order to configure your viewer.

string.description: Text shown inside the dialog box that shows up to help users configure their Cardboard experience. [CHAR LIMIT=200]
string.name: dialog_message_setup

resources.string: Set up your viewer for the best experience.

string.description: Short text for the title of the dialog box that shows up to help users configure their Cardboard experience. [CHAR LIMIT=30]
string.name: dialog_title

string.description: Short text shown in a button in the dialog box that shows up to help users configure their Cardboard experience. By clicking on this button, the user goes to the Cardboard app page on Playstore. [CHAR LIMIT=30]
string.name: go_to_playstore_button

string.description: Button text used as an affirmative action. [CHAR LIMIT=20]
string.name: got_it

string.description: Error message displayed as a Toast when Android could not find a browser to open a website. [CHAR LIMIT=50]
string.name: no_browser_text

string.description: Message asking the user to place their phone into Cardboard. This is a generic message used in the absence of knowing the current viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=50]
string.name: place_your_phone_into_cardboard

resources.string: Place your phone into your Cardboard viewer

string.description: Message format asking the user to place their phone into the Cardboard compatible viewer that is currently configured. [CHAR LIMIT=50]
string.name: place_your_viewer_into_viewer_format

resources.string: Place your phone into your %s viewer

string.description: Accessibility description for the settings button displayed at the bottom of a VR application. [CHAR LIMIT=50]
string.name: settings_button_content_description

string.description: Short text shown in a button in the dialog box that shows up to help users configure their Cardboard experience. By clicking on this button, the user is taken to the Cardboard app to setup their Cardboard viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=30]
string.name: setup_button

string.description: Text which when pressed, takes the user to the view that allows them to switch their Cardboard compatible viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=10]
string.name: switch_viewer_action

string.description: Prompt asking if the user wants to switch their Cardboard compatible viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=20]
string.name: switch_viewer_prompt

string.description: Title of dialog shown after the user pairs with their Cardboard viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=30]
string.name: viewer_configured_dialog_title

string.description: Message format shown after the user successfully pairs with a Cardboard viewer. viewer_name refers to the specific Cardboard viewer. [CHAR LIMIT=80]
string.name: viewer_configured_message_format

resources.string: The app is now configured for a %s viewer.
